title: ICE with const generics over a &'static str

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
This seems to be similar to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/60813 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/60814 but with a different stacktrace

```rust
#![feature(const_generics)]

struct Caca<const A: &'static str> {
    s: String
}

impl<const A: &str> Default for Caca<A> {
    fn default() -> Self {
        let a = Self::A;
        Self {
            s: A.to_string()
        }
    }
}

fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}

```

Stacktrace:


```
warning: the feature `const_generics` is incomplete and may cause the compiler to crash
 --> 1.rs:1:12
  |
1 | #![feature(const_generics)]
  |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default

error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/ty/subst.rs:496: Region parameter out of range when substituting in region '_ (root type=Some(&str)) (index=0)

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:854:9
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (ed33453a3 2019-12-25) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

query stack during panic:
#0 [typeck_tables_of] processing `<Caca<A> as std::default::Default>::{{constant}}#0`
#1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
#2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error

```
